trans-unit.source: Represents a trigger that applies property values or performs actions when a set of conditions are satisfied.
<xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> enables you to set property values or start actions based on a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Condition>s.

A condition is met when the value of the property (specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Property%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Condition> class) of the element matches the specified <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Value%2A>.
The comparison is a reference equality check.

You can then use setters or the <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase.EnterActions%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase.ExitActions%2A> properties to apply changes or start actions when all of the conditions are met.
The <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger.Setters%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> object can only consist of <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects.

Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> child to a <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> object implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.SetterBaseCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> object.
<xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects are not supported; only <xref:System.Windows.Style.Setters%2A?displayProperty=fullName> supports <xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.MultiTrigger"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Condition"></xref> objects.
Changes to property values are applied when all of the conditions in the collection are met.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*ZeroOrMoreConditions*
Zero or more <xref:System.Windows.Condition> objects.
<xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> enables you to set property values or start actions based on a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Condition> objects.

A condition is met when the value of the property (specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Property%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Condition> class) of the element matches the specified <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Value%2A>.
The comparison that is performed is a reference equality check.
The <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> applies the associated setters or actions when all of the conditions are true (binary and operation).

Note that for <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger>s, each condition in the collection must set both the <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Property%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Value%2A> properties.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Condition> page for more information.
The default is an empty collection.

Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> objects, which describe the property values to apply when all of the conditions of the <xref href="System.Windows.MultiTrigger"></xref> are met.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*ZeroOrMoreSetters*
Zero or more <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects.
<xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects are not supported.
<xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> enables you to start actions or set property values using <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects when a set of conditions have been met.
If there are two <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects in the same or different setter collections setting the same property, the Setter that is declared last is used.

Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> child to a <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> object implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.SetterBaseCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> object.
<xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects are not supported; only <xref:System.Windows.Style.Setters%2A?displayProperty=fullName> supports <xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects.
The default value is null.
Adds a child object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The text to add to the object.
